New talk: Haml and Sass in 15 minutes

SD Ruby just posted my talk on Haml and Sass (given at this month's meeting).

Haml is a drop-in replacement for embedded ruby templates that has really helped me tame wild and crazy view code (especially on bigger apps). Sass is sorta like Haml's kid brother. It transforms your CSS into something that feels more like Ruby. Cleaner syntax, dynamic variables and logic, auto-nesting. All good stuff.

If you've been on the fence about Haml, check out this talk.
